intro: Ocotea liesneri, commonly known as the Brazilian cinnamon tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the Lauraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, cinnamon-scented leaves and bark. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and has a dense, rounded crown. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a distinctive aromatic fragrance when crushed. The tree produces small, greenish-white flowers and is valued for its essential oils and medicinal properties.
